txt.en: You've found a torn page of a tome, frozen from the harsh weather of the mountains. Perhaps you can find other pages around Ered Mithrin and complete the story.
Pages of a tome can be found scattered around Ered Mithrin. Perhaps you can complete the story if you find them all.
Collect page 7
Collect page 8

\q'Beryl, bloodstone, sapphire, sard, 
Darkest onyx, diamond hard 
Gold and garnet filled their hoards 
And shone upon their shimm'ring swords'\q

\q'In olden days, when all was sundered 
Our sires left strongholds wrecked and plundered 
And hewed new homes far under stone 
To carve a kingdom of their own'\q
The story still seems incomplete.  This appears to be the first half of a poem written by the Zhélruka Dwarves. Perhaps the second half still exists somewhere, in some form.
Completed

\q'With iron fists and hammers strong 
They ruled a realm of storied song 
The glitt'ring mines and glimm'ring hall 
Of peerless, proud Thafar-gathol'\q
Lost Lore of the Dwarf-holds: Ered Mithrin
Collect page 1

\q'O reaches rich with gem and ore! 
Resplendent runes writ on the door! 
O kingly crown of ruby wrought! 
The forge-fires flaming ever-hot!'\q
Completed.
Collect page 2

\q'The harps grow still, the embers dim 
Our ballads glad grow black and grim 
For in the north and far away 
Our days drew short ‘neath Mountains Grey'\q

\q'The harps sing loud, the fires burn low 
Our thoughts now stray to long ago 
When in the north and far away 
The anvils rang ‘neath Mountains Grey'\q
Collect page 3

\q'Yet tales they tell of greater treasure 
Matchless wealth past mind and measure 
Mighty mithril, blazing bright 
That drenched the darkened depths with light'\q
Collect page 4
Collect page 5

\q'Now heed and hearken as I speak 
Of times that turned from blithe to bleak 
Fast and fearful came the fall 
Of fair, forlorn Thafar-gathol'\q
Frozen pages can be found scattered around Ered Mithrin.\n\nYou should collect the pages to complete the story.
Collect page 6
